definition[0]: the place in a theatre, cinema etc where tickets are sold
example[0]: Collect your tickets at the box office.
definition[1]: used to describe how successful a film, play, or actor is, by the number of people who pay to see them
note[1]: box office receipts/takings etc (=the number of tickets sold or the money received)
definition[2]: the place at a cinema or theatre where people can buy tickets
definition[3]: if a film or show does well at the box office, it sells a lot of tickets and so makes a lot of money
example[1]: The thriller was a hit at the box office.
example[2]: The group is suffering after a series of box-office flops.
